greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table T(n,k) (listed antidiagonalwise in order T(0,0), T(1,0), T(0,1), T(2,0), T(1,1), ...) giving the number of rooted plane binary trees of size n and height k.
reference: Luo Jian-Jin, Catalan numbers in the history of mathematics in China, in Combinatorics and Graph Theory, (Yap, Ku, Lloyd, Wang, Editors), World Scientific, River Edge, NJ, 1995.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..200, flattened
H. Bottomley and A. Karttunen, Notes concerning diagonals of the square arrays A073345 and A073346.
Andrew Odlyzko, Analytic methods in asymptotic enumeration.
formula: (See the Maple code below. Is there a nicer formula?)

This table was known to the Chinese mathematician Ming An-Tu, who gave the following recurrence in the 1730s. a(0, 0) = 1, a(n, k) = Sum[a(n-1, k-1-i)( 2*Sum[ a(j, i), {j, 0, n-2}]+a(n-1, i) ), {i, 0, k-1}]. - _David Callan_, Aug 17 2004

The generating function for row n, T_n(x):=Sum[T(n, k)x^k, k>=0], is given by T_n = a(n)-a(n-1) where a(n) is defined by the recurrence a(0)=0, a(1)=1, a(n) = 1 + x a(n-1)^2 for n>=2. - _David Callan_, Oct 08 2005
example: The top-left corner of this square array is
E.g. we have A000108(3) = 5 binary trees built from 3 non-leaf (i.e. branching) nodes:
The first four have height 3 and the last one has height 2, thus T(3,3) = 4, T(3,2) = 1 and T(3,any other value of k) = 0.
maple: A073345bi := proc(n,k) option remember; local i,j; if(0 = n) then if(0 = k) then RETURN(1); else RETURN(0); fi; fi; if(0 = k) then RETURN(0); fi; 2 * add(A073345bi(n-i-1,k-1) * add(A073345bi(i,j),j=0..(k-1)),i=0..floor((n-1)/2)) + 2 * add(A073345bi(n-i-1,k-1) * add(A073345bi(i,j),j=0..(k-2)),i=(floor((n-1)/2)+1)..(n-1)) - (`mod`(n,2))*(A073345bi(floor((n-1)/2),k-1)^2); end;
mathematica: (* or *) a[0] = 0; a[1] = 1; a[n_]/;n>=2 := a[n] = Expand[1 + x a[n-1]^2]; gfT[n_] := a[n]-a[n-1]; Map[CoefficientList[ #, x, 8]&, Table[gfT[n], {n, 9}]/.{x^i_/;i>=9 ->0}] (Callan)
xref: Variant: A073346. Column sums: A000108. Row sums: A001699.
Diagonals: A073345(n, n) = A011782(n), A073345(n+3, n+2) = A014480(n), A073345(n+2, n) = A073773(n), A073345(n+3, n) = A073774(n) - _Henry Bottomley_ and AK, see the attached notes.
A073429 gives the upper triangular region of this array. Cf. also A065329, A001263.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 31 2002
